{"id":518385849,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 years, 6 months","timestamp":1625596046,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"16 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/518385849/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"89.8 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    double findMedianSortedArrays(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2) {\n        int l1=nums1.size();\n        int l2=nums2.size();\n        int i=0,j=0,k=0;\n        vector<int>arr(nums1.size()+nums2.size());\n        while(k<(l1+l2))\n        {\n            if(i<l1 && j<l2)\n            {\n                if(nums1[i]<nums2[j])\n                {    \n                    arr[k]=nums1[i];\n                    i++;\n                }\n                else\n                {\n                    arr[k]=nums2[j];\n                    j++;\n                }\n            }\n            else if(i<l1)\n            {\n                arr[k]=nums1[i];\n                i++;\n            }\n            else if(j<l2)\n            {\n                arr[k]=nums2[j];\n                j++;\n            }\n            else \n            {\n                break;\n            }\n            k++;\n        }\n        \n        double median=0;\n        int l=l1+l2;\n        if((l%2==0))\n        {\n            median=(arr[l/2]+arr[l/2-1])/2.0;\n        }\n        else\n            median=arr[l/2];\n        \n        return median;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
